prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** *Shape*: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. *Height*: 0.3 units *Width*: 0.75 units *Length*: 0.75 units *Step 1*: Create a new coordinate system with euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] for part 1. *Step 2*: Begin by creating a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane, part_1 > sketch > face_1 *Step 3*: Draw the following lines and arcs to form a loop (loop_1) - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.525, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.525, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.3375] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.3375], End Point [0.75, 0.45] - line_4: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - line_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] *Step 4*: Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor as 0.75, part_1 > extrusion > sketch_scale *Step 5*: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: - Apply the euler angles: [0, 0, 0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] *Step 6*: Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the parameters as: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.3 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 This will generate part 1 -- a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. (Note: The design does not include any join or cut operations, making it a single solid body created as the final shape.)</description>

Part 2 Create an inset for the prism Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.4286, 0, 0.4286) with no rotation. Create a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Sketch the inset Create a loop consisting of four lines: 1. A line from (0, 0) to (0.3214, 0) 2. A line from (0.3214, 0) to (0.3214, 0.2143) 3. A line from (0.3214, 0.2143) to (0, 0.2143) 4. A line from (0, 0.2143) to (0, 0) Extrude the inset Extrude the sketch by 0.3214 units in the negative Z direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3214. Cut the current part with the previously created part. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel to each other and meet at right angles. The prism has a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units (with a base length and width of 0.75 units and a height of 0.4286). The inset dimensions are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 0.3214 (with a base length and width of 0.3214 units and a height of 0.3214).</description>
